test.name: Connect to SQL Server Database with Windows Authentication

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Connect To Database Using Custom Params
kw.msg: Executing : Connect To Database Using Custom Params : pyodbc.connect(db_api_2.connect(RobotDatabase))

Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\AbdullahAmir\Documents\Databse\DatabaseProject\.venv\lib\site-packages\DatabaseLibrary\connection_manager.py", line 383, in connect_to_database_using_custom_params db_connection = eval(db_connect_string) File "<string>", line 1, in <module> NameError: name 'RobotDatabase' is not defined
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using the map string `db_connect_string` (parsed as a list of named arguments).

kw.name: Query
kw.arg: CREATE TABLE students (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(50), age INT);
kw.doc: Runs a query with the ``selectStatement`` and returns the result as a list of rows. The type of row values depends on the database module - usually they are tuples or tuple-like objects.

kw.name: Log Many
kw.doc: Logs the given messages as separate entries using the INFO level.
